data.title: Super Deluxe Sub, Super indeed!
data.text: Stopped in for dinner and drinks on a Saturday night and was very pleased!  Drinks were cold, service was great and the super deluxe sub with pizza sauce and home made chips was excellent!  Would stop in here again with no hesitation!

data.title: Lunch buffet okay at best
data.text:
I have driven past Frankie V's many times over the years but for no particular reason have never stopped.  Today, I needed to meet a colleague and the location was convenient, so we met at Frankie V's.

I arrived first.  While waiting, I noticed maintenance both inside and out had been neglected.  We each opted for the buffet.  The salad portion of the buffet was fine but the hot portion was hit pretty hard.  I started to wonder what was really supposed to be on it and whether or not we had made a mistake by selecting the buffet.  I asked the waitress and she told me pizza was on the way.  Sure enough, a minute later two single item pizzas appeared.

The salad was fine but the pizza was disappointing.  I am sure they made it from scratch in the back but I easily could have confused it for a frozen pizza.  Our service was very good.  The waitress had her cute daughter helping her.

Would I got there again?  Not a chance.  Even if the food is normally better, I cannot imagine it would jump up enough to be satisfactory.  Looking at the interior, it made me think that at one time this was probably a popular sports bar but tastes have changed and the lack of business makes it difficult to pay the bills for maintenance and renovations.

data.title: sports night
data.text: great food, especially their Pizza! Good beer selection and lots of tv's- even have a nice pool table.

data.title: Italian night
data.text: I was surprised at the large portions and the low price. For food this good they could charge more and it would still be a bargain.

data.title: We have returned here often!
data.text: We first tried Frankie V's because we had a coupon for the lunch buffet. Now it has become a spot we like to go for dinner. I love the variety of delicious Italian dishes, and my husband who is not a fan of Italian food is happy to have a full menu to choose from. We prefer to sit in the dining area nearest to the door. We can still see enough of whatever sport is on TV, but we enjoy the atmosphere which seems just a bit more intimate. The sauces are awesome! The prices are reasonable too.

data.title: MSU Game
data.text: Slipped in to watch the MSU football game and had a great time. The food was great, the menu was plentiful, and the prices were good. We started with a huge plate of nachos and then I had a great burger. The wife had a very tender steak. Overall the experience was awesome. The TV's were huge as well, I was having an issue on which one to watch though.

data.title: Good Food, Good Prices
data.text: I met some family members at Frankie V's for dinner.  They were late so I sat at the bar and ordered a drink.  My call drink was only $4.00 and it was a good drink - - I usually pay around $8.00 for a drink.  When my family members showed up we went to a table and ordered a pizza, a mad burger and a chicken panini.  There were a couple fo large groups there ordering.  Our food came out in a good time and it was tasty.  I especially liked the pizza, the sauce was good.  The sandwiches were good, solid food.

data.title: Nice Sports Bar
data.text: Good sized place.  No cramped.  Food was served timely and hot. Service was promt and friendly. Good value for the money.  Not fantastic, but no bad either.

data.title: Vegetarian Options
data.text: Our family had lunch here today while passing through the area.  I was impressed that there were several vegetarian items listed on the menu. The server was very nice.  She was the only server on duty.  She worked very hard running the bar, cleaning and setting tables, while keeping up with orders.  The place was somewhat busy, but she kept up very well.  The food was excellent.

data.title: over served
data.text: My husband gets over served there all the time.  We go to other places and this only happens at Frankie.  They don't even ask if he wants another drink they just put in front of him.  They only seem to care about selling beer!  Food isn't good or the service.  Stay away, nothing good can come from going there.

data.title: Frankie V's...lots of favorite things
data.text: My favorite salad is at Frankie V's it is the spinach salad with cranberries, walnuts, feta cheese, and I use Honey mustard for my dressing....they have great food, service is good, and just a great atmosphere....

data.title: Great food. Service ok
data.text: The food here has always been great and good price. Service varies sometimes it's good other times it lacks. But overall you're average pizza joint.

data.title: Frankie Vitale’s
data.text:
Frankie V’s Pizzaria and Sports Bar

10-10-2014

We have eaten here six times and still have another ten trips to go. There are so many interesting items to try yet.  In checking the online menu, I see a meatball dinner that I missed seeing while dining- so make that eleven trips. www.frankievs.com   I’ve tried the meatball sub a month ago, however, and it needed a touch of oregano or pepper to make it perfect. They do have it, I should have asked.

The Fish & Chips comes with the ordinary dark dry breading which most bars serve. The owners told me to  ask for a wet batter next time and the cook will oblige even though it is not listed on the menu.  Not wanting to leave the place unfulfilled, I ordered a pizza sub and yes, all was well again on the satisfaction scale.  

 When sitting in a booth, my buddy watches a video screen and comments on some action taking place. Me, looking the other direction, find a screen that matches his description and can join in the conversation.

The wait staff is interesting at times. Several, in the course of your meal might stop by your booth and inquire or bring you items. You order from one server and another brings it. The one “gal” that told me how to order fish next time, looked vaguely familiar.  I went home and Googled Mary Steenbergen and I was so right. This look-a-like “gal” identified herself as the half owner.  

We have all remarked about servers that clearly were in the wrong profession. Conversly, Frankie V’s has a delightful new waitress that truly has THE server calling. (She works the elevated booth seating area as you come in) 

Included is a picture of their unusual (but empty) two foot high beer pitcher/dispenser.

data.title: Mom & Pop pizza place
data.text: We ordered a 16" pepperoni pizza. The wait time was 15 minutes. The pizza was excellent. The sauce is sweet. They also serve pizza by the slice. The couple that owns the place were very nice. Our pizza was part of a special because of the Metro Car Cruise. We paid $9.00. Very good and we would order pizza from here again. They are located in a little strip mall on 28th street and Burlingame.

data.title: Good Buzztime group
data.text: Looking for somewhere to play Buzztime sense BWW went Pepsi. Find this place online. Good service, clean, accommodating, good food. I will go back....

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: Great Food, Great Service and a surprisingly affordable drinking.  Everything is more than fairly priced and their Happy Hour is ridiculous $2.75 for tall domestics you can't beat it!

data.title: Good food, good venue, good value!
data.text: After pulling into the location, I was hesitant on what we would find when we stepped in. To my pleasant surprise, there was a nice outdoor patio to dine on and a large open seating area inside. We went on a Sunday night and there were a good five tables dining in where we decided to sit. There seemed to be only one waitress in the whole joint doing most of the work with a random girl or two helping out. For as large as the place was, it was strange to see a "seat yourself" sign. There had to have been a few more tables scattered down near the bar area, as she kept going down there as well. Our waitress was friendly and knowledgable, but since she was the only one waiting tables, it took a while to get drinks, to-go boxes, the check, etc. We ordered cheese bread and a pepperoni pizza. I also ordered the Italian wedding soup, which was not what I was expecting, but tasty nonetheless. Someone from the back brought out each part of our meal as our waitress attended to others' needs. Everything tastes pretty good-the pizza crust was a little too fired for me and lacked a little flavor, but all-in-all a really good meal for the price. We ordered a medium for 2 adults an 1 kid and had almost half a pizza to take back to the hotel--glad we decided against the large at the last minute! Would definitely return back here if the opportunit arose! Just hope by that time they will have hired some waitstaff!!!

data.title: Great food, disappointing service
data.text: I have eaten here several times with friends. The pizza is wonderful, and I've never been disappointed in any other item I've ordered. Each time I have patronized them however, I have received increasingly substandard service. From unacceptable wait times to wait times that would have been acceptable had we been greeted and not left standing around and feeling like an idiot, and finally a server who was downright rude. I have finally just decided that there are other places that I can get food just as good with employees that understand how to take care of their patrons

data.title: Hidden Gem!
data.text: Frankie V's was very good! The service was friendly and quick. The atmosphere was typical of a sports bar. Yet, it was not too loud- we could talk. The food was good! We only had a pizza but it sure did hit the spot! You should go if you're in the area!

data.title: Interesting atmosphere.
data.text: Interesting atmosphere.
